It forces me to write better and more idiomatic Rust (the codebase will likely be much larger than anything Iâ€™ve dealt with). Itâ€™s fun : the 6502 is a fun CPU to study and emulate. Currently Learning ğŸŒ±
SICP and Scheme
SICP stands for the â€œStructure and Interpretation of Computer Programsâ€ and itâ€™s bloody ridiculously good. It is essentially a course in what Iâ€™d like to call â€œthe essence of computationâ€. Thereâ€™s no way to completely describe what it is - youâ€™ll just have to read the text yourself, or watch the lectures (available on MIT OCW).
Category Theory
Category Theory is a branch of mathematics and computer science that allows us to mathematically model practically any program. This allows us to write unimaginably robust and extensible code. Iâ€™m reading Category Theory for Programmers and recemmend it to anybody who wishes to dive into the absolute depths of abstraction. Besides, itâ€™s good for the mathematical muscles! ğŸ˜‰
DSA and Competitive Programming
Iâ€™m currently working very hard to get better at DSA-based problems. Iâ€™m currently super into trees and graphs and have been solving a lot of problems related to them. To follow my CP progress, do checkout my CP Repository
